articles.headline: Leery of Washington, Alaska Feasts on Its Dollars
articles.snippet: No state benefits more from federal largess, but a senator voted against the stimulus bill and the governor decries “intrusive” policies.
articles.abstract: No state benefits more from federal largess, but a senator voted against the stimulus bill and the governor decries “intrusive” policies.
articles.lead_paragraph: PALMER, Alaska  Backed by a blue row of saw-toothed mountain peaks, the Republican state lawmaker Carl Gatto finds himself on a fine roll.

articles.headline: Pension Fraud by New Jersey Is Cited by S.E.C.
articles.snippet: Federal regulators accused New Jersey of securities fraud for claiming it was funding public workers’ pensions when it was not.
articles.abstract: Federal regulators accused New Jersey of securities fraud for claiming it was funding public workers’ pensions when it was not.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal regulators accused the State of New Jersey of securities fraud on Wednesday for claiming it had been properly funding public workers’ pensions when it was not.

articles.headline: Finding New Ways to Fill the Tank
articles.snippet: A new federal agency is financing attempts to find a renewable replacement for gasoline and diesel fuel, like a new liquid fuel or a much better battery.
articles.abstract: A new federal agency is financing attempts to find a renewable replacement for gasoline and diesel fuel, like a new liquid fuel or a much better battery.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Most research on renewable energy has focused on replacing the electricity that now comes from burning coal and natural gas. But the spill in the Gulf of Mexico, the reliance on Middle East imports and the threat of global warming are reminders that oil is also a pressing worry. A lot of problems could be solved with a renewable replacement for oil-based gasoline and diesel in the fuel tank  either a new liquid fuel or a much better battery.

articles.headline: Simplifying the Lives of Web Users
articles.snippet: A new service called OpenDNS is faster and more reliable than your Internet provider’s. And it’s free.
articles.abstract: A new service called OpenDNS is faster and more reliable than your Internet provider’s. And it’s free.
articles.lead_paragraph: I’m about to make your life better. No need to thank me.

articles.headline: General Motors Files for an Initial Public Offering
articles.snippet: The regulatory filing begins the process of the carmaker becoming a public company again and letting the federal government begin selling down its shares.
articles.abstract: The regulatory filing begins the process of the carmaker becoming a public company again and letting the federal government begin selling down its shares.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  General Motors filed Wednesday for a landmark public stock offering that would let the federal government begin selling off its stake in the automaker as well as raise money for G.M.’s turnaround.
articles.byline: By Nick Bunkley and Bill Vlasic

articles.headline: Despite Scandals, Indian Mining Bosses Thrive
articles.snippet: Illegal mining has become a national scandal amid accusations that billions of dollars of minerals have been stolen.
articles.abstract: Illegal mining has become a national scandal amid accusations that billions of dollars of minerals have been stolen.
articles.lead_paragraph: BELLARY, India  Janardhana Reddy insists he is not a king. No, no, no, he protested, as a servant trotted across the courtyard to deliver a cup of cooled water. Men with machine guns stood outside. An architect waited to discuss the new mansion, while another man hovered nearby, sitting in the grass.

articles.headline: Montenegro Reaches for Respectability With Port
articles.snippet: A small country bordering the Adriatic Sea hopes to use foreign investment to create a playground for the super-rich and clean up its image of corruption.
articles.abstract: A small country bordering the Adriatic Sea hopes to use foreign investment to create a playground for the super-rich and clean up its image of corruption.
articles.lead_paragraph: TIVAT, Montenegro — “This is better than St. Tropez,” Milo Djukanovic, the prime minister of Montenegro, exclaimed as he took in a display of yachts berthed in this mountain-shrouded bay on the eastern shore of the Adriatic Sea.

articles.headline: Egg Recall Expanded After Salmonella Outbreak
articles.snippet: An Iowa company broadened a recall of its eggs to 380 million after hundreds of people got sick across the country.
articles.abstract: An Iowa company broadened a recall of its eggs to 380 million after hundreds of people got sick across the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: An Iowa company on Wednesday broadened a nationwide recall of its eggs to 380 million after some of its facilities were linked to an outbreak of salmonella that has sickened hundreds of people across the country.

articles.headline: Civilians to Take U.S. Lead as Military Leaves Iraq
articles.snippet: As the U.S. military prepares to leave Iraq, the Obama administration is planning a remarkable civilian effort.
articles.abstract: As the U.S. military prepares to leave Iraq, the Obama administration is planning a remarkable civilian effort.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  As the United States military prepares to leave Iraq by the end of 2011, the Obama administration is planning a remarkable civilian effort, buttressed by a small army of contractors, to fill the void.

articles.headline: Founder Terminating Hedge Fund
articles.snippet: Stanley F. Druckenmiller told clients that he was quitting the business and shutting down his investment firm, Duquesne Capital, after 30 years.
articles.abstract: Stanley F. Druckenmiller told clients that he was quitting the business and shutting down his investment firm, Duquesne Capital, after 30 years.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stanley F. Druckenmiller, the hedge fund titan who led George Soros’s famous bet against the British pound, told clients on Wednesday that he was quitting the business and shutting down his investment firm, Duquesne Capital, after 30 years.
articles.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Peter Lattman

articles.headline: Jurors Fault Complexity of the Blagojevich Trial
articles.snippet: The jurors, evenly split on some counts, took several days just to figure out how to make their task manageable.
articles.abstract: The jurors, evenly split on some counts, took several days just to figure out how to make their task manageable.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO  As the jurors in the corruption case against Rod R. Blagojevich, the former Illinois governor, entered a 25th-floor conference room here, one problem was instantly clear: They were overwhelmed.
articles.byline: By Monica Davey and Susan Saulny

articles.headline: Markets Fall as Jobless Filings Rise
articles.snippet: New applications for unemployment insurance reached a half million last week, pointing to a job market that is struggling.
articles.abstract: New applications for unemployment insurance reached a half million last week, pointing to a job market that is struggling.
articles.lead_paragraph: A slowdown in American manufacturing and weak employment data sent stocks lower on Thursday as investors continued to absorb news of a weak economic recovery.

articles.headline: With McAfee Deal, Intel Looks for Edge
articles.snippet: With the $7.68 billion acquisition Intel becomes a major player in the security software and services market.
articles.abstract: With the $7.68 billion acquisition Intel becomes a major player in the security software and services market.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Hoping to accelerate its move into smartphones and consumer electronics, the chip maker Intel has turned to security software and services as a way to separate its products from those of its rivals.
